titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

p.hi: I wrote notes for a sermon in Jarrow on Sunday evening next, when the parson desires me to speak about the Revised Prayer Book. It would seem that there is some Protestant opposition developing in his parish.
that he might stay on for yet another fortnight.
After lunch I walked round the Park.
came to play lawn tennis, & stayed to dinner.

A telegram informed Fearne that her father was dead. She decided to go home on Monday. The funeral is arranged for Wednesday. It would appear that the Stoick philosophy does not lack followers among our younger women.
